item.title: Sci-fi 2D / 3D hybrid platformer Knights of the Fall announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Uncover how interdimensional travel and the afterlife could be connected.

Publisher Bohemia Interactive and developer Airo Games have announced Knights of the Fall for PC (Steam). A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Knights of the Fall is a science-fiction 2D / 3D hybrid platformer that tells the story of Haru, a combat veteran, and Yoshida, his scientist sidekick, who join forces to uncover how interdimensional travel and the afterlife could be connected, using time and gravity-bending technology.

In 1947, the secret agency NASS was founded to decode mysterious cosmic signals, triggering Japan’s rapid technological boom.

However, in 1986, the ignition of a zero-point energy reactor ripped open a gateway to another dimension, inviting alien life to Earth and plunging the planet into a desperate battle for survival.

Amid survivors, Haru allies with Yoshida, a former NASS scientist, and together they navigate a world forever altered, with the hope of saving Earth and those trapped in singularity anomalies.

Key Features

  • Gravity and Time-Bending Technology – Harness a singularity reactor to bend gravity and warp time itself. Use these powers tactically to manipulate the battlefield and disarm enemies with brutal efficiency, executing them in inventive and satisfying ways.
  • Unique Tactical Combat – In a post-apocalyptic world where weapons are scarce, survival means improvisation. Turn enemy strength into their weakness. Redirect attacks, lure them into dangerous crossfire, and exploit every opening.
  • Range of Enemies – Face a wide range of enemies, each with distinct AI behavior, combat patterns, and unique weaknesses.
  • Intense Boss Battles – Clash with bosses that mirror your own abilities. Outsmart them, turn their strengths against them, and manipulate the chaos of the battlefield by using lesser enemies as your weapons.
  • Unique Atmosphere – Experience a hand-painted, post-apocalyptic world brought to life through a cinematic 2D/3D hybrid style. Traverse ruined cities, overrun hospitals, underground NASS labs, and warped anomalies where past and future collide. Each level offers new traversal challenges and hidden lore.
  • ‎Immersive Narrative – Discover the overlapping stories of survivors and those trapped within singularity anomalies. Through scattered diaries, lost recordings, and fragmented memories, guide Haru on a journey to uncover the hidden truth.
  • Soundtrack – A carefully composed, cinematic score brings the post-apocalyptic world to life, deepening the emotional impact of every encounter and discovery.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: Easy Delivery Co. launches September 18
item.content:encoded:
• PC

A relaxing driving game with strange secrets.

Easy Delivery Co., a driving game set in a quiet mountain town “where something feels just a little… off,” will launch for PC via Steam on September 18, publisher Oro Interactive and developer Sam C announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Easy Delivery Co. is a relaxing driving game, with definitely no secrets. You’ve been hired as a delivery driver in a once-lively scenic mountain town now plagued with inhospitable weather. Make deliveries and uncover the story of the town’s not-at-all mysterious residents, all while earning well below minimum wage.

Pick Up. Drive. Deliver. Dream of escaping.

Key Features

  • Earn a “living” by delivering packages with your kei truck.
  • Take in the atmospheric scenery or blitz through (road safety not required).
  • Buy drastically overpriced gas and get to know the locals.
  • Simple controls and retro graphics.
  • Listen to cool beats while driving.
  • Split-screen race mode with up to four players.
  • Nothing strange going on, no lore, nothing at all, we promise.

Watch the announcement trailer below.

Release Date Trailer

item.title: City Connection announces TGS 2025 lineup, schedule
item.content:encoded:
New title to be announced on September 24.

City Connection has announced its lineup and schedule for Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan. A dedicated website will be opened at a later date.

Get the details below.

■ Lineup

  • Final Formation (Switch, PC)
  • Mamorukun Curse! (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Switch, PC)
  • R-Type Delta: HD Boosted (PS5, Xbox Series, PS4, Switch, PC)
  • RUSHING BEAT X: Return of Brawl Brothers (PS5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PC)
  • Secret Title – To be announced on September 24

■ Stage Schedule

September 27

  • 13:00 – City Connection 20th Anniversary Event: Captain Flag Game Tournament – America Zarigani’s Yoshiyuki Hirai, City Connection 20th Anniversary Special Ambassador, will host a game tournament using the 1993 Jaleco arcade game Captain Flag. Additionally, JaJaMaru-kun, a character from the Ninja JaJaMaru game available via Nintendo Entertainment System – Nintendo Switch Online, will appear at the booth, so come take a photograph with him!
  • 14:00 – R-Type Delta: HD Boosted Talk Show – A special talk show with the producer and director of R-Type Delta: HD Boosted ahead of its November 20 release. Viewers can look forward to behind-the-scenes development stories, production details, and an introduction to what makes this game unique. Additionally, members who were involved in the development of the original R-Type Delta will appear on stage as guests. Stay tuned for a special talk where the history and current state of a game cross paths.

item.title: Truxton Extreme reveals co-op mode
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5

Playable at Tokyo Game Show 2025.

Shoot ’em up revival Truxton Extreme will feature a cooperative mode, allowing two players to team up, publisher Clear River Games and developer Tatsujin announced. A demo of the game will also be playable at Tokyo Game Show 2025, which will run from September 25 to 28 at Makuhari Messe in Chiba, Japan.

Here is an overview of the cooperative mode and game, via Clear River Games:

About

On the sofa, no-one can hear you scream, but Truxton Extreme champions a whole new cooperative mode which will allow players to team up with fellow space fighters to defend Earth from the horrific nightmare fuel that befalls them—and means there will always be someone to listen to your blood-curdling cries of defeat. Players can revive one another if the challenge becomes too much and they pull them back from the brink of destruction. Using the mighty Thunder Laser, they can also redirect each other’s weapons in evil’s direction using the metal hull of their attack ship, now that’s teamwork! The thrashing metal tentacles, slithering mechanical serpents, insectoid features and plethora of deadly spikes of the hostile Geranium invasion will have no chance against your team of cosmic defenders as you lead them through a carnival of arcade horde-shattering action.

The original Truxton, a groundbreaking shoot-em-up in its time, was lovingly crafted by Tatsujin CEO Masahiro Yuge back in 1988 with the goal of creating a scrolling shooter where muscle memory was a key feature – and you’ll certainly put those reflexes to the test with this new iteration of the franchise. Fans of the long-running shooter series will be delighted to discover that Truxton Extreme has been developed with the same vision in mind, and leans heavily into the shmup DNA that made Truxton such a memorable hit in gaming’s golden era. The brand-new game features modern 3D visuals and the non-stop shooting intensity expected from Truxton titles, all the while preserving the series’ iconic design, adding multiple modes, including an episodic digital comic-book telling the story of the three protagonists. The soundtrack created by Masahiro Yuge features remastered Truxton tracks and brand-new pieces created exclusively for this title. In it, Yuge uses his skills as a classically trained pianist to bring an extra level of musical magic to the game.

Key Features

  • 18 chapters of arcade action, accompanied by an animated comic-book story from manga artist and character designer Junya Inoue.
  • Eight unique stages.
  • Multiple devastating weapons, including fan favorites from the original games.
  • New original soundtrack and reimagined classic tracks.
  • Team mode, join forces with fellow space fighters to defend Earth from the evil attackers.
  • Multiple game modes, including Heart Starter mode for less experienced players.

Truxton Extreme is due out for PlayStation 5 and PC via Steam in 2025.
